result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sidney Sharod Helton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sidney Sharod Helton in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  Defense has received all discovery and an offer from the State and requests a Jury Trial be scheduled. 
Court sets the deadline of 11/11/2022 for filing of Jury Instructions, Motions in Limine, Witness lists and Change of Plea forms. Court sets the deadline of 11/01/2022 for State to provide crime lab report.
Matter adjourned to Br. 9.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sidney Sharod Helton in court by video with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn who appears in person.  Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer F. Vences. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.    
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to Branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sidney Sharod Helton in court, appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 6/4/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Sidney Sharod Helton in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/02/2022@1:30p
